intro: Brachystelma buchananii, commonly known as the Buchanan's ice plant, is a succulent species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, typically during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
